intro: Callista huttonii, commonly known as the Hutton's callista, is a flowering plant native to New Zealand. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes parsley and carrots, and is characterized by its aromatic foliage. The plant features compound leaves with finely divided lobes and produces small, white to pale yellow flowers arranged in umbels. It is often found in coastal and subalpine regions, thriving in well-drained soils. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and vulnerable species.
